Articles.Content:
> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/bPSoG)

Anyone familiar with Captain Harlock should be familiar with this craft. Prototyped in about an hour.

The airbrakes at the front are only for show, but can function to slow the craft slightly. With SAS on, she flies like a dream, stable as a rock. With SAS off, she tends to nose down, but is still flyable. She isn't fast or maneuverable, but she's still fun to fly.

And to answer the question I always had as a kid, "How do they land with a wing on the bottom of the plane?"; the answer is: very, very carefully.

Put some more work into the SW-190, and for now, I am calling it complete. Later on, I might do a few cosmetic tweaks here and there, if I feel the urge.

Final form:

![vGuaKp6.png](http://i.imgur.com/vGuaKp6.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-01T20:21:09Z" title="06/01/2015 08:21  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 1, 2015</time> by nipulsansei**
  
Update

Nice! Job well done! I have no idea that there are capt. Harlock fan in KSP forum.

P.S. a download link will be even better!

As requested: [The SW-190 Space Wolf.](http://www./download/r5oqcx4eqbbkd2q/SW+190.craft)

And indeed, I've been a fan of the Captain since Galaxy Express 999. Pity they had to go and make an ugly CGI out of him, though.
